Part C | Markets fail with externalities.

In Part A we set up the landscape of what's possible. But we left with the question where on the PPF is best. In Part B we introduced markets as a way to arbitrate which point on the PPF we should choose. And we showed that competitive markets without externalities deliver a quantity that maximizes Total Surplus.

But not every market is competitive or without externalities. In Part C we introduce the concept of Market Failure, when markets deliver a quantity that society does not want. We then introduce a government policy to correct this failure. This is a first introduction externalities and corrective taxes, our first setting where markets fail.

Reading | Ch. 6 Ch. 8 Ch. 10

Start Part C by skimming the reading to develop an understanding of the scope of what's being discussed.

Then once you've finished reading, take a look at the practice material, and use the text as a resource when you need help. This way, you know what's most important, get to practicing quickly, and know where to find help when you innevitably get stuck.

Vignette C1

Vignette C1 is a novel scenario about a government policy we examine as a class.

Vignette C2

Vignette C2 is a novel scenario about a policy solution to a positive externality we examine as a class.

Demo Cs

Demo Cs are very similar to the type of problems you'll see on MiniExam C. There are two versions, taken from past semesters. These are resources for you to use as you'd like. But here's my advice. Start by trying to solve them on your own. Or even better, grab a classmate and find a whiteboard in the library. Then once you've worked through enough to give yourself some confidence, use the video and solutions to check your work. You're more than welcome to watch this video first, but you're not going to catch your weak points as easily, which is the main point.

Demo C1 Solutions

Demo C1 works through an externality and a policy solution. This is reposed with a correction to the DWL.

Demo C2 Solutions

Demo C2 also works through welfare measures with an externality.

Demo C4 Solutions

Demo C4 also works through two questions about externalities and goverment policies, assigned as a homework demo in past semesters.

MiniExam C

MiniExam C will be held on February 16 and covers everything in Part C. If you understand the concepts and do the work in the Vignettes and Demos, you're going to be in good shape on the MiniExam.
